title: Design Thinking-Based Technology-Enhanced Social Studies Education Design for Pre-Service Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Basic smart device utilization skills, understanding of elementary social studies curriculum, familiarity with fundamental history/geography concepts
context.additional_context: A course for in-service elementary teachers to strengthen creative application skills when not exposed to social studies technology modeling in practical settings. Focuses on using digital tools to foster citizenship and cultural diversity understanding.

learning_goals: Learners generate at least three strategies (e.g., digital timeline creation for historical data analysis) to activate students’ critical thinking when designing social studies-technology integrated lessons using design thinking tools.
Learners develop at least two technology-integrated lesson scenarios based on real social studies classroom cases (e.g., regional culture comparison projects) collected in mobile environments.

Learners reflect on at least three peer feedback sessions, propose at least one improved social studies learning support plan (e.g., AI-based local issue simulation tools) within two weeks, and submit a report meeting at least two of three evaluation criteria (innovation, feasibility, effectiveness).

resources: Access to Real-Time Collaboration Tools (e.g., Miro)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
